intro: Zygostates lindmanii, commonly known as the Lindman's zygostates, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
